instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A loop
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that keeps rebooting on the Apple logo. With the trackpad disconnected, It goes to the login screen.
IÂ´ve already replaced the keyboard, trackpad and cable, but with the same result, witch seams to indicate that is something related with the board.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> diode reading is 0.529.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> = 12.5V

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A loop
threads.message:
Check with known good battery and original 85W Magsafe 2 charger.
Also test with external macOS.

Same thing happens booting into safe mode?
No errors pop up into diagnostic mode?
